newsitem.title: TUNISIA: TUNISIAN TREASURY RAISES 20 MILLION DINARS AT AUCT.
newsitem.headline: TUNISIAN TREASURY RAISES 20 MILLION DINARS AT AUCT.

text.p: The Tunisian Treasury raised 20 million dinars at its weekly auction of treasury bills dated April 1, and repaid maturing paper totalling 23.8 million dinars.
It sold two-year paper payable at maturity worth 10 million dinars at a 6.9375 percent coupon rate, and two-year paper payable in equal annual tranches at a 6.8750 percent coupon rate.

Banks bid for 219 million dinars for two-year notes at between 6.8750 and 7.8125 percent. The Treasury said it didn't open the auction for for 13-, 26- and 52-week notes, on which the only paper sold during the last weeks. (one $=1.07 dinar)
